transcript.text: [Music]
[Music]
hi and welcome you listening to the x 22
rapport my name is david this is episode
1077 a and today's date is September 16
2016 and thought of the episode is
Europe is in crisis mode us enters
recession Europe collapses now before I
get started I just want to make an
announcement tomorrow saturday i'll be
uploading an interview with bill murphy
he is from georg if you are on the x 22
report email alert system i'll email you
if you subscribe to youtube you should
get an email from youtube if not you can
go to youtube and type in x 22 report
spotlight should bring you to the video
or you can come over to the x 22 report
com site all you have to do is scroll
down a little bit you look over to your
right you'll see the video there or you
can go to news sentinel com same thing
scroll down a little bit look over to
your right hand side and you can view
the video there let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
today on the market we see it is Friday
once again and they couldn't get the
market where they wanted it to go the
market closed down today gold is down a
little bit and what we're seeing right
now it's getting more more difficult for
the high-frequency traders the plunge
protection team to keep the market up as
hard as they work there are those who
are selling off and the only way the
market is staying up right now is with
the creation of free money and they're
taking this for your money and they're
putting it into the market that's what
the plunge protection team does they
have an allotment of funds and they take
it and they put it into the market to
keep it up so what we're seeing right
now is that whatever their allotment is
it's not enough they need more of it and
this is why Yellen is out there talking
about more money printing creating more
currency to the tune of four trillion or
maybe more because they're starting to
realize that as this market continually
collapses it's going to become more more
difficult to keep this entire system
alive
and one we look at all these economic
indicators we are seeing the total
destruction of this economy I mean we've
been tracking this and everyone has to
understand how this works the central
bankers they keep the illusion alive as
long as they possibly can it's not like
you wake up tomorrow and the system was
fine one day and collapse the next day I
mean this is what many people believe
they believe that a look we were fine
one day and all of a sudden it collapsed
and then these people come out who say
you know oh you've been telling us about
the collapse of the system well it
doesn't work the way everyone thinks it
works what they do is they keep the
illusion alive as long as possible and
sometimes it goes for two years
sometimes it goes for five years but
what we're doing right now is we're
tracking all of these years to show how
it's coming down because when it does
come down and the market collapses it's
not because the economy was fine one day
and terrible the next what's happening
is is that the illusion is being ripped
apart over these years and the economy
is continually deteriorating and I'm not
talking about the stock market I'm
talking about manufacturing I'm talking
about retail I'm talking about people
who who are employed who are unemployed
now I'm talking about everything that's
going on in this country rail traffic
trucking bulk dry shipping corporate
defaults that's what we're looking at
and slowly as they built the illusion up
the illusion starts to fall apart and
that's what we've been tracking we're
watching it slowly fall apart and when
we get to that point when it collapses
it was because the system has already
collapsed and this is the last part of
it which is the stock market so when
people say well the system hasn't
collapsed well no
it it's a build-up and we reach this
certain point where this system cannot
be sustained anymore and they know it
and they have to bring it down or
something comes out of left field and it
brings it down for them think about what
happened during 2008 with the subprime
crisis this just didn't happen overnight
one day it was fine the next day it was
bad this was a buildup people were
continually defaulting on their
mortgages people were continually buying
more houses people were continually
defaulting the illusion was kept alive
with raiding these subprime securities
with triple-a triple-a no they're fine
the market continually rose the market
continually rose and this went on for
many years in the meantime we had
bubbles all over the place and
eventually what happened is the illusion
met the real collapsing of the economy
and we had the whole thing implode and
we're seeing the same thing happened
once again when we look at this economy
right now we see that the Fed is saying
that there's no inflation whatsoever but
we do see inflation we see inflation in
rentals we see inflation in medical
costs we see inflation in housing we see
inflation in all of these areas other
areas they're able to control think
about why they lower the fuel prices
there are many agendas associated with
this once they lower fuel prices
shipping becomes less expensive
production becomes less expensive and if
it's less expensive the prices of the
goods they don't rise they can actually
stay the same or fall if you shrink a
prior a product and you remove the
number of ounces or remove the number of
tissues or napkins and sell it for the
same price well it doesn't look like
inflation but it
and these are all the tricks they've
used so we've seen inflation and what
we're seeing right now is that the core
CPI it's serg x plus two point three
percent year-on-year this is the highest
since 2008 this is the tenth month in a
row above the feds mandate of two
percent stable growth and we see that
rentals homes there are three point
eight percent inflation we see medical
services continually rising so we are
seeing inflation we see the University
of Michigan their survey results are
showing that the people are looking at
the economy and they believe the
conditions are getting worse and we can
see right now they have dropped
dramatically from about a hundred and
eleven points down to a hundred and
three point five this is the lowest
since october of 2015 because people are
starting to wake up they're starting to
realize there's something dramatically
wrong here we know that europe they're
in crisis mode right now italy right now
has been in crisis for at least eight
months even though the mainstream media
they didn't want to recognize anything
until about july but they were having
problems way before this and it has
nothing to do with the brexit whatsoever
they have high performing levels of
non-performing loans and this has been a
problem for quite a while they're
carrying loans that are non performing
and they're actually defaulting on these
NPLs rather than writing them off and we
can see right now that seventeen percent
of italy loans will not be repaid and
this is going to crush the italian
banking system now the only way to help
italy is with a government bailout but
there's a problem
Italy is not only part of the EU but
part of the eurozone and such they can't
print their way out of this crisis and
EU regulations make it difficult for the
government to bail out banks so what do
they have they have something called a
bail-in which means they're going to be
going after the depositors and
accreditors and we can see right now
that the italian banks they are
deteriorating very quickly and actually
when you look at Europe and Germany we
see that there's a real threat here
because if the u.s. goes into recession
Europe collapses because we know that
Germany and other countries in the EU
they've been shifting their exports to
the US if the u.s. goes into recession
demand for German goods French goods and
other European goods it drops and a
small percentage drop in exports well
guess what that's going to destroy the
European countries and we can see right
now the United States is already in a
recession right now Europe is reeling
now of course there's no announcement
from the government they're keeping this
quiet because the government if you
study how they report on recessions they
don't report on recessions until maybe
69 a year later and they say oh yeah by
the way the recession really started you
know 2016 of January but they don't
report it right off the bat even when
we're entering a recession they don't
like to report it now Angela Merkel said
the European Union is in a critical
situation because even though it's not
mentioned that we're in a recession they
still see that the demand for their
goods is dropping and dropping very
quickly and they realize that they're in
a tough situation and what she's saying
right now is they need to come up with
some type of
solution because they realize that their
economies are starting to take a dive
and the situation is going to get worse
and worse as time goes on because there
was a study saying that there's an
eighty eight percent chance that were
headed into a recession from what I'm
looking at and from all these economic
indicators we've been in a recession for
quite a while and actually the recession
is moving into a depression now of
course they can keep the illusion up
just like they did prior to 2008 we were
in this recession before the stock
market crashed in 2008 we were in a
recession the beginning of 2008 but they
kept the illusion alive they made
everyone think that no no we're not a
recession even though these banks and
these corporations are laying off even
though all these subprime securities
they're all garbage everything is going
bankrupt all these different companies
and we can see right now we're in the
same situation but it's much much worse
think about what happened in 2008 it
affected like something like thirty
eight percent of the population here in
the United States many people lost their
wealth their house they never found the
same type of job again and here we are
eight years later now those people never
really recovered they never went out and
purchased another big house they might
have purchased a smaller house they
might just continually rent they have
two three four part-time jobs more
people being laid off today this is the
second round and when this second round
of this collapsed hits it's going to be
a complete disaster because it's going
to wipe out all those that were hit
first and all those people that weren't
hit well they're going to get hit hit
this time and it's going to be horrific
and we can see right now that we are
accelerating the pace of this economic
deterioration it is not getting better
it is gay
worse and the powers that be the elite
the central bankers they all know this
they realize where we are headed and we
can see that perfect storm is coming up
this fall does it mean we're going to
have a collapse this fall well we don't
know if something comes out of left
field that they don't you know something
they don't expect yes it will bring it
down but they're planning on doing it
themselves and I mentioned it yesterday
where it's going to be a two-parter
because they want to bring it down
because they need more control and the
only way that they can get more control
is to have an event and this event would
be an economic crisis this way they can
use the economic crisis to push
legislation in their favor of course
because they need to make things better
doesn't matter how many people are hurt
doesn't matter how many jobs are lost
doesn't matter how many companies are
bankrupt doesn't matter how many people
lose their money in the banking system
because of balance that doesn't matter
their whole agenda right now is to have
this economic crisis to push certain
legislation through to take more control
of the economy because they know they
can't depend on the people they can't
depend on the people to boost this
economy because people have no jobs
people aren't spending manufacturing is
a disaster put all the pieces together
the only way it can stay afloat is if
the central bank goes out and has their
hand in every aspect of the economy
while the people sit on the sidelines
and the only way to do this is to have
an event a crisis and this is what's
coming and I wouldn't be surprised
if it happens maybe this year or next
year because the clock is ticking down
listen everyone thanks a lot for
listening be well be safe and especially
be prepared thanks a lot
you
